Class: Session

otr. Session

Constructor

new Session(user, account, contact, parametersopt)

Session class is an EventEmitter, that handles the OTR protocol. You can optionally add an online() method to the instance which should return true if contact is online. This determines wether to send hearbeats or not. If method is not added contact is assumed to be online.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
user User -
account Account -
contact Contact -
parameters OTRParams <optional>
 -
Source:
  • otr.js, line 679

Call the destroy method to remove all event listeners and release resources used by the session.

Events

create_instag

"create_instag" Session event will be raised if an OTR conversation was attempted an the account does not have an instance tag. It is a good practice to make sure an instance tag is generated before starting a session.
Source:
  • otr.js, line 844

create_privkey

"create_privkey" Session event will be raised if an OTR conversation was attempted an the account does not have an OTR key. It is a good practice to make sure a private key is generated before starting a session.
Source:
  • otr.js, line 830

disconnect

"disconnect" Session event is fired when contact ends the private conversation. The session will be in Finished state.
Source:
  • otr.js, line 816

gone_secure

"gone_secure" Session event, is called when connection becomes encrypted
Source:
  • otr.js, line 730

inject_message

"inject_message" Session event, is fired when a message fragment should be sent to contact
Type:
  • function
Parameters:
Name Type Description
message string message fragment to be sent.
Source:
  • otr.js, line 755

message

"message" Session event is fired when receiving a plaintext or decrypted message from contact
Type:
  • function
Parameters:
Name Type Description
message string
isEncrypted boolean true if message was received in private
Source:
  • otr.js, line 901

msg_event

"msg_event" Session event is fired when some type of exceptional event has occured that your application may want to be aware of. Your application may want to write an event to a log file, display a message to the user, or ignore the event. While it is not required to implement this operation, it is probably a good idea.
Type:
  • function
Parameters:
Name Type Description
msgevent Object properties value (otr.MSGEVENT),name,message,error
Source:
  • otr.js, line 792

new_fingerprint

"new_fingerprint" Session event is fired when we see a fingerprint not on file. This is fired before gone_secure event and will be followed by write_fingerprints event.
Type:
  • function
Parameters:
Name Type Description
fingerprint string
Source:
  • otr.js, line 767

plaintext

"plaintext" Session event is fired after ending our side of the private conversation and returning to plaintext mode.
Source:
  • otr.js, line 925

"received_symkey" Session event is fired when contact has decided to use the extra symmetric key

Name Type Attributes Description

 if an smp request came with a question

update_context_list

"update_context_list" Session event is fired when contacts are added or removed.

write_fingerprints

"write_fingerprints" Session event is fired when a new fingerprint is seen and when a fingerprint is successfully authenticated with SMP
